meanings.definition: A particularly bad or unpleasant part of an event or situation.
meanings.sent1: The lowlight of the party was when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent2: The meeting had many high points, but the lowlight was when the projector stopped working.
meanings.sent3: It was a lowlight when the dog ran off with the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: The lowlight of the movie was the confusing ending that left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The lowlight of the camping trip was when it started raining and we had to huddle under a small tent.

meanings.definition: A dim light used to create shadows or highlight certain features in photography or cinematography.
meanings.sent1: The photographer used a lowlight to add drama to the portrait.
meanings.sent2: In the studio, they adjusted the lowlight to create a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The lowlight cast eerie shadows on the wall, making it look like a haunted house.
meanings.sent4: The lowlight gently illuminated the actor's face, giving it a soft glow.
meanings.sent5: The cinematographer strategically placed the lowlight to enhance the mood of the scene.
